intro: Pouzolzia indica subvar. minor, commonly known as the lesser Indian pouzolzia, is a flowering plant belonging to the family Polygonaceae. It is a perennial shrub characterized by its slender, erect stems and small, elliptical leaves that are often covered in fine hairs. The plant produces clusters of tiny, greenish-white flowers that are typically arranged in racemes. It thrives in moist, shaded environments and is often found in tropical and subtropical regions. Due to its ornamental value and ecological significance, it is sometimes cultivated in gardens and natural habitats.
